criterion: Reward for documenting that the previous fluticasone 110 mcg inhaler fell off formulary and was replaced with a 220 mcg per-actuation canister
Reward for recording the new dosing instructions: one puff in the morning and one puff at night (no longer two puffs each time)
Reward for noting that a clear spacer was provided and for including the specific technique instructions (shake, attach, slow 4-second inhale, 5-second hold)
Reward for capturing the patient’s reported adherence barrier (locker line closes before lights-out leading to missed evening dose) and resulting nocturnal cough/chest tightness
Reward for documenting the brainstormed and agreed plan to store the inhaler in the nurses’ cabinet until 10 p.m. with a clinician note (and mention of alternate phone alarm idea)
Reward for including counseling about side effects: gargling/rinsing to avoid ‘frog throat’, reassurance about steroid dose and weight gain, monitoring for thrush
Reward for overall completeness: the note coherently summarizes all major exchange points from the encounter without omitting any of the above key items
Penalize for failing to update the medication list and directions (e.g., leaving the outdated 110 mcg BID entry or omitting the new 220 mcg regimen)
Penalize for introducing clinical details or recommendations not present in the transcript or chart
Penalize for copying irrelevant or extraneous chart information unrelated to this visit (e.g., unrelated immunizations, family history not discussed)
